channel.title: mycatalog updates
channel.description: 'My Catalog' uses the IBM Cloud catalog API to retrieve data from the catalog. It attempts to be as accurate as possible. This feed shows additions, updates, removals from the catalog. Use with care. It is a work-in-progress :)

item.title: [added] BUS4i System Copy - Migrate 23 for Power i (tsp-bus4i-system-copy-migrate-23-for-power-i)
item.description: BUS4i System Copy moves and migrates your IBM I to another. Backup and restore your data and applications in a single step

item.title: [added] Cloud Reservations for VPC (is.reservation)
item.description: Save up to 60% by reserving capacity in advance on IBM Cloud Virtual Servers for VPC.

item.title: [added] Dizzion Digital Workspaces - Complete (dizzion-digitalworkspaces-complete)
item.description: Putting the service in Desktop as a Service, this offering is perfect for organizations who want a completely hands-off approach.

item.title: [added] Komprise Elastic Data Migration (komprise-elastic-data-migration)
item.description: Analytics driven file and object data migration. 27x faster, cost-effective, scale-out SaaS. Know first, move smart, save more.

item.title: [added] Komprise Intelligent Data Management Suite (komprise-intelligent-data-management-suite)
item.description: Analyze, migrate, tier, archive, manage file and object data at scale simply and reliably. Optimize costs, deliver data value.

item.title: [added] Multi Volume Snapshots for VPC (is.snapshot-consistency-group)
item.description: Regional Multi Volume Snapshot Service to securely back up block storage data to IBM Cloud Object Storage

item.title: [added] VPC COaaS (VPC Cost Optimization as a Service) (wanclouds-inc--vpc-coaas-vpc-cost-optimization-as-a-service-)
item.description: Wanclouds' Managed Multi-Cloud Cost Optimization as a Service offering for IBM

item.title: [removed] App Connect (appconnect)
item.description: Connect your applications, automate tasks, and improve productivity

item.title: [removed] Microsoft 365 Backup as a Service by Storagepipe (storagepipe-microsoft-365-backup-as-a-service)
item.description: Storagepipe SOC II Compliant Backup for your critical Microsoft 365 data including Exchange, Teams, SharePoint and OneDrive

item.title: [updated] Bare Metal Servers for VPC (is.bare-metal-server) has a new plan named bx3-metal-48x256
item.description: Pricing plan for an bx2 bare metal server configured with dual processors offering 24 cores (48 vCPU), 256 GB memory, local NVMe boot drives, and up to an aggregate 200Gbps network uplink.

item.title: [updated] Bare Metal Servers for VPC (is.bare-metal-server) has a new plan named bx3-metal-64x256
item.description: Pricing plan for a bx3 bare metal server configured with dual processors offering 32 cores (64 vCPU), 256 GB memory, local NVMe boot drives, and up to an aggregate 200Gbps network uplink.

item.title: [updated] Bare Metal Servers for VPC (is.bare-metal-server) has a new plan named bx3d-metal-48x256
item.description: Pricing plan for a bx3d bare metal server configured with dual processors offering 24 cores (48 vCPU), 256 GB memory, local NVMe boot drives, secondary NVMe drives for local storage, and up to an aggregate 200Gbps network uplink.

item.title: [updated] Bare Metal Servers for VPC (is.bare-metal-server) has a new plan named bx3d-metal-64x256
item.description: Pricing plan for a bx3d bare metal server configured with dual processors offering 32 cores (64 vCPU), 256 GB memory, local NVMe boot drives, secondary NVMe drives for local storage, and up to an aggregate 200Gbps network uplink.

item.title: [updated] Bare Metal Servers for VPC (is.bare-metal-server) has a new plan named vx3-metal-16x256
item.description: Pricing plan for a vx3 bare metal server configured with dual processors offering 8 cores (16 vCPU), 256 GB memory, and up to an aggregate 200Gbps network uplink.

item.title: [updated] Bare Metal Servers for VPC (is.bare-metal-server) has a new plan named vx3d-metal-16x256
item.description: Pricing plan for a vx3d bare metal server configured with dual processors offering 8 cores (16 vCPU), 256 GB memory, local NVMe boot drives, secondary NVMe drives for local storage, and up to an aggregate 200Gbps network uplink.

item.title: [updated] Databases for Elasticsearch (databases-for-elasticsearch) has removed the plan named standard
[updated] Dedicated Host for VPC (is.dedicated-host) has removed the plan named gen2-dedicated-host
[updated] Hyper Protect Crypto Services (hs-crypto) was removed from the Sydney catalog
[updated] Knowledge Catalog (datacatalog) is the new name of Watson Knowledge Catalog
[updated] Knowledge Catalog (datacatalog) has changed the description of the plan named enterprise-bundle
item.description: *before*: The Enterprise Bundle for Watson Knowledge Catalog is a volume discounted plan that enables organizations to build a data governance framework so that users can understand their data better., *after*: The Enterprise Bundle for IBM Knowledge Catalog is a volume discounted plan that enables organizations to build a data governance framework so that users can understand their data better.

item.title: [updated] Knowledge Catalog (datacatalog) has changed the description of the plan named lite
item.description: *before*: The Lite plan provides you with a free trial of Watson Knowledge Catalog to begin your journey to becoming a data-centric organization., *after*: The Lite plan provides you with a free trial of IBM Knowledge Catalog to begin your journey to becoming a data-centric organization.

item.title: [updated] Knowledge Catalog (datacatalog) has changed the description of the plan named standard-v2
item.description: *before*: The Standard plan for Watson Knowledge Catalog is a pay-as-you-go service that offers everything you need to build a data catalog so that users can easily inventory, find and prepare assets for their self-service analytics needs., *after*: The Standard plan for IBM Knowledge Catalog is a pay-as-you-go service that offers everything you need to build a data catalog so that users can easily inventory, find and prepare assets for their self-service analytics needs.

item.title: [updated] MQ (mqcloud) has a new plan named reserved-capacity
item.description:
Provisioning of your single-tenant environment may take up to 24 hours. This plan is purchased using Capacity Units which provide 5 VPC of capacity for deploying queue managers each. You will be charged for your dedicated environment as soon as it is provisioned.
Once provisioned, you deploy queue managers into your dedicated environment using the ‘Reserved Deployment’ plan. For more information on plans, please see ‘Service Plans’ in our documentation.

item.title: [updated] MQ (mqcloud) has a new plan named reserved-deployment
item.description: Deploy queue managers into a Reserved Capacity environment.

item.title: [updated] Qiskit Runtime (quantum-computing) has changed the description of the plan named paygo-standard
item.description:
*before*: **Systems** Two systems, one 127 qubit Eagle processor and one 27 qubit Falcon processor. Time limits = program-specific up to 8 hours. Qiskit Runtime Second = time counted to process a job. No charge for job queue time.
**Simulators** Five simulators (QASM, statevector, mps, stabilizer, and extended stabilizer). Time limits = program-specific up to 3 hours.
**Performance management strategies** One strategy provided by IBM with 3 resilience levels. (Q-CTRL Embedded strategy coming soon)., *after*: **Systems** Four systems, three 127 qubit Eagle processor and one 27 qubit Falcon processor. Time limits = program-specific up to 8 hours. Qiskit Runtime Second = time counted to process a job. No charge for job queue time.
**Simulators** Five simulators (QASM, statevector, mps, stabilizer, and extended stabilizer). Time limits = program-specific up to 3 hours.
**Performance management strategies** Two strategies: • IBM 3 resilience levels. • Q-CTRL AI-driven automated error reduction. **No additional cost**.

item.title: [updated] Red Hat OpenShift on IBM Cloud (openshift) was made available in the Toronto catalog
[updated] Red Hat OpenShift on IBM Cloud (openshift) was made available in the Sao Paolo catalog
[updated] Red Hat OpenShift on IBM Cloud (openshift) was made available in the Osaka catalog
[updated] watsonx.data (lakehouse) was made available in the London catalog
[updated] watsonx.data (lakehouse) was made available in the Tokyo catalog
[updated] watsonx.governance (aiopenscale) is the new name of Watson OpenScale
[updated] watsonx.governance (aiopenscale) has a new plan named essentials
item.description: The watsonx.governance Essentials plan enables organizations to monitor AI Models for quality, health, and trust metrics; explanations and what-if analysis, and automatically document model metadata with custom use cases.

item.title: [updated] watsonx.governance (aiopenscale) has a new plan named lite
item.description:
The watsonx.governance Lite Plan offers everything you need to begin your journey to governing AI models across your business, including access to explanations, bias detection and mitigation, and automated AI capabilities.
Internal Postgres db instance that supports the above capacity; Data cannot be migrated from this instance; If upgrading to Essentials plan and continuity is required from Lite plan, please provision your own paid instances of supported databases from IBM Cloud Catalog

item.title: [updated] watsonx.governance (aiopenscale) has changed the description of the plan named standard-v2
item.description:
*before*: The Watson OpenScale Standard v2 Plan will help accelerate your adoption of AI by building confidence in its outcomes and scaling it across your business. You'll have full access to OpenScale's capabilities, with pricing based on consumption., *after*: The Watson OpenScale Standard v2 Plan will help accelerate your adoption of AI by building confidence in its outcomes and scaling it across your business. You'll have full access to OpenScale's capabilities, with pricing based on consumption.
API docs - https://cloud.ibm.com/apidocs/ai-openscale Docs - https://dataplatform.cloud.ibm.com/docs/content/wsj/model/getting-started.html?context=cpdaas

item.title: [updated] VPC+ DRaaS (VPC+ Disaster Recovery as a Service) (3p-wanclds-draas-vpcplus) was removed from the Dallas catalog
[updated] Watson OpenScale (aiopenscale) has removed the plan named lite
